Pomoc Mozilli 


 problem when forwarding e-mails directly
  • calm.home5344* 15 paź 2023, 20:39:25

Warning! That is a lot of personal info; you should delete the attachment immediately!

You're showing the email headers. I don't know how to turn it on/off in a unsent outgoing email. Does it actually show them in the received message? When I save the email as *.eml file, it will show all the headers in text. They are basically the background instructions that make the email able to be sent. Think of it as google maps instructions on how to travel from one destination to another.

  • Unikaj oszustw związanych z pomocą.* Nigdy nie będziemy cię prosić o dzwonienie na numer telefonu, wysyłanie SMS-ów ani o udostępnianie danych osobowych. Dowiedz się więcej. <https://support.mozilla.org/kb/avoid-and-report-mozilla-tech-support-scams>

Oznacz jako rozwiązane <https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/questions/1427682/solve/1611348?watch=RbeVpfEbEM&utm_campaign=questions-reply&utm_source=notification&utm_medium=email> Ta odpowiedź nie rozwiązuje mojego problemu <https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/questions/1427682?utm_campaign=questions-reply&utm_source=notification&utm_medium=email#answer-1611348>

Przejrzyj pytania bez odpowiedzi i pomóż użytkownikowi Firefoksa <https://support.mozilla.org/questions?filter=unsolved> Rozwiązując 1 problem pomagasz codziennie ponad 1000 osobom Ten e-mail został automatycznie wysłany przez robota. Nasz robot nie może odpowiadać na twoje pytania, ale nasi współpracownicy z forum mogą! Jeśli chcesz im odpowiedzieć, kliknij tutaj <https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/questions/1427682?utm_campaign=questions-reply&utm_source=notification&utm_medium=email#answer-1611348>. Zmień ustawienia powiadomień <https://support.mozilla.org/pl/users/settings> Anuluj subskrypcję tego typu powiadomień <https://support.mozilla.org/pl/unsubscribe/2269465?s=RbeVpfEbEM>
creator: michal.serzysko

content:
Warning! That is a lot of personal info; you should delete the attachment immediately!

You're showing the email headers. I don't know how to turn it on/off in a unsent outgoing email. Does it actually show them in the received message? When I save the email as *.eml file, it will show all the headers in text. They are basically the background instructions that make the email able to be sent. Think of it as google maps instructions on how to travel from one destination to another.
creator: calm.home5344

content: PS As a heads up, please do not use capital letters as it implies you are shouting at the very person who is offering their free time as a volunteer to help you. I'm letting you know about this because it's possible you are not aware of what capital letters mean in a forum. However, it's OK to use capital letters in certain circumstances, as an example if emphasizing something such as in my previous comment.
creator: Toad-Hall

content:
When a default setting is applied by the developers in a completely new set of code, the one used is chosen to suit a wide user base, but it's impossible to know what every user desires because people use different screen resolutions and different scales and different size screens and on top of that people have different eye sight requirements. So what works on one monitor/screen may not work on another. It's just not possible to get it perfect for everyone.

That's why Thunderbird 115* has improved the ability to set up everything to tune to each persons requirements. You do not need to access the Config Editor nor use a 'userChrome.css'.

Please read this info:

Via 'Menu Bar' toolbar:

  • View > Font Size > increase font size - repeat clicks on this to increase size in increments.

Via 'Menu app' icon on Unified toolbar:

  • Menu app icon > Font Size - click on the + icon to increase font size - repeat to increase size in increments.

The above will effect Folder Pane, Message List, Menus etc. It will also effect the 'Message Pane' to varying degrees because that area may also be controlled via :

  • Settings > General
  • Under 'Language & Appearance'
  • click on 'Advanced'
  • Select 'Fonts for : 'LATIN'
  • Set all the font sizes making sure the minimum size font is lower or same size'
  • Then select 'Fonts for: 'OTHER WRITING SYSTEMS'
  • repeat exactly the same for all font size settings so they match what you set up in 'LATIN'
  • Finally reselect 'LATIN'
  • Click on 'OK'

As an example - I like size 12px for Font size in Folder Pane etc, but in my incoming messages and emails I compose, I prefer to set a font size of 16 and a minimum size of 12.
creator: Toad-Hall
